questions.question: What is the concept of 'levelised cost of electricity' (LCOE)?
options: The total cost of installing a renewable energy system
The average cost of electricity per unit of electricity produced over the lifetime of a renewable energy system
The cost of producing one unit of electricity at peak demand
The cost of storing one unit of electricity in a battery
questions.correct_answer: The average cost of electricity per unit of electricity produced over the lifetime of a renewable energy system

questions.question: What is the Betz Limit in context of wind energy production?
options: The maximum fraction of power of the wind that can be extracted by a wind turbine
The highest wind speed at which a wind turbine can operate
The maximum height that a wind turbine can be built
The limit to the number of wind turbines that can be installed in a given area
questions.correct_answer: The maximum fraction of power of the wind that can be extracted by a wind turbine

questions.question: What is the main challenge associated with the use of hydrogen as a renewable energy source?
options: The conversion of hydrogen into electricity is inefficient
The production of hydrogen requires large amounts of energy
The storage of hydrogen is difficult due to its high reactivity
The extraction of hydrogen from water is a complex process
questions.correct_answer: The production of hydrogen requires large amounts of energy

questions.question: Which of the following is a disadvantage of 'concentrated solar power' (CSP) systems?
options: They are less efficient than photovoltaic solar panels
They require direct sunlight to operate efficiently
They cannot store energy for use when the sun is not shining
They require a large amount of water for cooling
questions.correct_answer: They require direct sunlight to operate efficiently

questions.question: What is the 'energy returned on energy invested' (EROEI) in context of renewable energy sources?
options: The ratio of the amount of energy produced by a renewable energy source to the amount of energy used to produce it
The ratio of the amount of energy produced by a renewable energy source to the amount of energy stored in it
The ratio of the amount of energy used to produce a renewable energy source to the amount of energy it can produce over its lifetime
The ratio of the amount of energy produced by a renewable energy source to the amount of energy used to maintain and operate it
questions.correct_answer: The ratio of the amount of energy produced by a renewable energy source to the amount of energy used to produce it

questions.question: What is the role of 'phase change materials' (PCMs) in renewable energy systems?
options: They are used to convert direct current (DC) to alternating current (AC)
They are used to store thermal energy
They are used to increase the efficiency of photovoltaic cells
They are used to regulate the voltage of the electrical output
questions.correct_answer: They are used to store thermal energy

questions.question: Which of the following renewable energy sources is not typically used for grid-scale energy production?
options: Wind
Solar
Tidal
Geothermal

questions.question: Which renewable energy source has the highest energy density?
options: Solar
Wind
Hydro
Bioenergy

questions.question: What's the major advantage of 'perovskite solar cells' over traditional silicon-based solar cells?
options: They are more efficient
They are less expensive to produce
They can be made flexible and lightweight
All of the above

questions.question: What is 'feed-in tariff' in the context of renewable energy?
options: The cost of feeding renewable energy into the grid
A tax on non-renewable energy sources
A premium rate paid for electricity fed back into the electricity grid from a designated renewable electricity generation source
A subsidy for the installation of renewable energy systems
questions.correct_answer: A premium rate paid for electricity fed back into the electricity grid from a designated renewable electricity generation source
